frameDefinitions: A Sleeper transitions from a state of consciousness where they are largely unaware of their environment to a wakeful state.

An Agent has attempted to achieve a Goal, and the actual outcome of the Agent's action has been resolved, so that it either specifically matches the Agent's intent (e.g. success) or does not match it (e.g. failure).
A Protagonist is in the dynamic, maintained state of being alive or has exited this state.
A Protagonist which had been dead returns to life.
An Agent or Cause causes a Process or State to end.
A salient Subevent has a Pattern of recurrence within a larger Process.
frameExamples: He <t>pulled</t> <t>off</t> his April Fool's Day prank by the barest of margins .
He'll <t>come</t> <t>back</t> from the dead at 11:03PM exactly, since that's what his suicide note indicated.
Bush may <t>lift</t> sanctions on his own, despite opposition.
Tony's fingers tapped <t>rhythmically</t> on the keyboard
listRoleDefinitions: This role identifies the sleeping entity.
This describes the state out of which the <fen>Sleeper</fen> awakens.
This role identifies the <fen>Time</fen> when the event occurs.
This role identifies the <fen>Place</fen> where the event occurs.
The <fen>Agent</fen> makes an attempt to achieve a <fen>Goal</fen>.
The <fen>Goal</fen> is what the <fen>Agent</fen> attempts to achieve.
A participant function in a particular event or in events of a particular kind.
This role identifies the <fen>Time</fen> when the attempt succeeds or fails.
The place where an attempt succeeds or fails.
<fen>Protagonist</fen> identifies the being or entity that is  dead or alive.
This role identifies the <fen>Figure</fen> or form being described by the target.
The time in which the <fen>Protagonist</fen> is dead or alive.
The being or entity that becomes living again.
The time at which the resurrection occurs.
The location at which the <fen>Protagonist</fen> returns from the dead.
A <fen>Process</fen> which is ended by the <fen>Agent</fen> or <fen>Cause</fen>.
The individual who causes the <fen>Process</fen> or <fen>State</fen> to end.
An event that causes the <fen>Process</fen> or <fen>State</fen> to end.
A <fen>State</fen> which is ended by the <fen>Agent</fen> or <fen>Cause</fen>.
The <fen>Time</fen> when the <fen>Process</fen> or <fen>State</fen> is ended.
The location where the <fen>Process</fen> or <fen>State</fen> is caused to end.
The larger event that is characterized by the recurring Subevents.
The salient, punctual event that is construed as part of a <fen>Process</fen>.
The <fen>Pattern</fen> that can be detected in the recurrence of  the <fen>Subevent</fen>s of the <fen>Process</fen> .
listRoleExamples: He awoke <fex>out of a deep dream</fex>.
If you don't succeed <fex>in your subterfuge</fex>, then report back for further orders.
Benedikt was successful <fex>as a master brewer of beer</fex>.
<fex>On the bridge</fex> he succeeded in putting the wig on the corpse.
If <fex>the Lord</fex> resurrected in three days, surely he could relieve my back pain in, say, a week.
<fex>That move</fex> ended her political career, she said in a 1994 Times Union interview.
They ended their relationship <fex>in the same coffeehouse where it started</fex>.
The rhythm <fex>of the rain falling on the roof</fex> kept me awake
The music had a driving rhythm

sourceCandidateSpans.text: the Spiritual Exercises for the Catholic Encyclopedia
the first day of the week
the Upper Room of the Cenacle
